abstract.p: NYC police arrest Steven McFadden in Elmhurst section of Queens on weapons charges after finding extensive collection of weaponry in his apartment (S)

block.p: The police arrested a man on Monday who they say kept an arsenal of weapons in his Queens apartment.

The man, Steven McFadden, of 87-30 Justice Avenue in Elmhurst, had an extensive collection of weaponry: 15 rifles, 18 handguns, two military fuses, brass knuckles, a blackjack, assorted swords, a pint of black powder and thousands of rounds of ammunition, said Officer Gary Cillo, a police spokesman.

Mr. McFadden has been charged with criminal possession of a weapon, Officer Cillo said.
The police received a tip that Mr. McFadden was keeping weapons in his apartment.
Detectives knocked on his door at 9 p.m. Monday and he let them inside, Officer Cillo said.
